channel.title: Core Engine - Innovating Beginners
channel.description:
[center][URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/10/swingcore2.png/][IMG]http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/4698/swingcore2.png[/img][/URL]
The idea of Swing Core was thought through by [i]X Entinity X[/i] and is being developed by [i]X Entinity X[/i]. [i][b]The development will be running quite slowly because it will be done in my spare time, unless I sort out a development team[/b][/i].
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/515/swingcore.png/][IMG]http://img515.imageshack.us/img515/4060/swingcore.png[/img][/URL]
Core Engine is a game engine developed for beginner programmers to develop off (for their java games). It innovates good code; allowing the engine to run a lot smoother. A decent rendering system for a 2D game and the [i]Tool Kit[/i] method to allow all operating systems function. It will include many features from key handling right through to the actual core of the graphics and the ideas behind it all.
Nearly all operating systems work with Core Engine; including Linux.
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/341/41757636.png/][IMG]http://img341.imageshack.us/img341/9357/41757636.png[/img][/URL]
20x25 dimension of the blocks.
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/845/coreenginesupport.png/][IMG]http://img845.imageshack.us/img845/2095/coreenginesupport.png[/img][/URL]
Mouse-movement
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/811/26429756.png/][IMG]http://img811.imageshack.us/img811/492/26429756.png[/img][/URL]
[b][i]Every working output will be implemented with the System.out.println for debugging purposes (to show you something works/ to see if something works).[/b]
[i]More coming soon ;).[/i] [/center]

item.title: Core Engine - Innovating Beginners
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

[center]

The idea of Swing Core was thought through by X Entinity X and is being developed by X Entinity X.
The development will be running quite slowly because it will be done in my spare time, unless I sort out a development team.

Core Engine is a game engine developed for beginner programmers to develop off (for their java games).
It innovates good code; allowing the engine to run a lot smoother. A decent rendering system for a 2D game and the Tool Kit method to allow all operating systems function.
It will include many features from key handling right through to the actual core of the graphics and the ideas behind it all.

Nearly all operating systems work with Core Engine; including Linux.

20x25 dimension of the blocks.

Mouse-movement

[i]Every working output will be implemented with the System.out.println for debugging purposes (to show you something works/ to see if something works).

More coming soon ;).
[/center]

Read full topic
